results.title: History of Australian Cinema [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Anthony Buckley
results.brief_description:
“History of Australian Cinema Series”.
Three part documentary series about the history of the Austalian Motion Picture industry. “The Pictures That Moved” describes the intense activity in the Australian film industry from the first screening at the Melbourne Opera House in 1896 to the decline of the industry in the early 1920’s. Extracts from productions of particular interest are shown, including “Soldiers of the cross”, “Living Hawthorn”, “The Story of the Kelly gang”, “A Girl of the bush”, “On our selection” and “The Sentimental bloke”, with stills, contemporary press reports and interviews. Shows the technical advances gained, and the exhibition of the national character in a wide range of films. Shows the running of the first filmed Melbourne Cup in 1896 and a finals game of VFL at the Melbourne Cricket Ground between South Melbourne and Carlton. “The Passionate Industry” traces the history of the Australian film industry in the decade 1920-1930. Includes material from fifty newsreels, sixteen feature films and still photographs drawn from many collections. “Now you’re talking” - The 30s saw the introduction of the “talkies” and a new era of filmmaking began. This was to decline with World War II. Excerpts from many of the films made during this decade are seen in this work. Also available on VHS and 16mm [008384], [012586], [012406].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Anthony Buckley

results.title: History of Australian art. Part 1 (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian art”.
This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1788-1920. It investigates the European traditions, the Heidelberg School and the beginnings of Post-Impressionism and abstraction. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA. IBM PC and Compatible; Windows 3.1 or higher, 4MB RAM, 4MB free disk space, VGA display, MPC Compatible CD ROM XA.

results.title: History of Australian art
results.brief_description: This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1788-1991. It investigates the European traditions, the Heidelberg School and the beginnings of Post-Impressionism and abstraction. From Margaret Preston to Brett Whitely, controversial modernist art, and the influence of American styles such as Abstract Expressionism. It also investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works.

It also investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works.

results.title: History of Australia (PC)
results.brief_description: Provides a detailed account of Australia’s history based on a thematic format with significant events. Contains over 50 minutes of video and hundreds of pictures. The CD-ROM has lots of features such as notes and highlights, memory function and advanced search functions and is an excellent educational resource. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: MPC compliant PC386 DX, Hard disk, CD-ROM, Windows 3.1, 256 colour windows display driver. Also runs in Windows 95.

results.title: History of a day
results.brief_description:
The time lapse photography in History of a Day offers an exhilarating view of a ‘day’ unfolding before our eyes in just four minutes. The five screens of the installation surround the viewer with multiple sunrises, sunsets and lightning storms - a global dance of energy and light not available to us from our usual fixed and single perspective.

History of a Day shows us the Earth as a spinning ball of elements, driven by the laws of gravity and physics, producing, in the words of the artists, ‘a cosmic special effects theatre in continuous production, simultaneously all over the earth.’

Cinematographer Simon Carroll has been photographing time-lapse sequences for twenty years, and has amassed a large archive of material from which History of a Day was constructed. His work has been used in many films, including The Matrix (1999). Composer Martin Friedel has written music for film, theatre, opera and the concert hall, using both traditional and new media forms. He is currently a Creative Fellow at the State Library of Victoria.

(FT 30.03.05)

results.title: History of a battle
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC) and Manuel Gomez
results.brief_description: This film is part of a series that constitutes a historical record of revolutionary development in Cuban society, with this particular one focusing on the literacy campaign of 1961. With English commentary.

results.title: History lesson
results.brief_description: A song in the folk idiom about a history lesson illustrated with newsreel footage of recent historical events such as the first atomic bomb, Hitler, Nazi rallies, Neville Chamberlain, scenes of poverty in Asian countries, and the Vietnam War.

results.title: History in action
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Julia Spark
results.brief_description: History, when viewed with hindsight, has the aura of inevitability. This series reviews key events of the 20th Century and examines the reaction to these events as they actually occurred. Each programme uses original material such as newspapers, photographs, archival footage, cartoons and music to enhance the contemporary feel.

results.title: History brought to life. King of kings
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, Pathé Frères and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: History brought to life (9 mins) hosted by Cecil B. DeMille unfolds the glory of early Hollywood and its massive industry at work, providing a dazzling array of stars and historic milestone film events. “King of kings” (1927-112 mins) acknowledged as the definitive film of Jesus, presents the story of Christ as a moving portrait seen through the eyes of Mary Magdalene.
results.title_for_label: History brought to life. King of kings
